The following procedure describes the determination of 3' terminal nucleosides in yeast tRNA<sup>Phe</sup> and mouse piRNAs as described previously<sup>5</sup>.
This method can be applied to any RNA molecule that does not possess a 3'-phosphate at its 3' terminus.
1) Dissolve >0.8 µg of yeast tRNA<sup>Phe</sup> or mouse piRNAs in 13.4 µl of Milli-Q water.
2) Add 1.6 µl of 500 mM ammonium acetate buffer \(pH 5.3) and
4) Incubate the mixture at 37 °C for 3 hours.
5) Analyze the hydrolysate by using the LC/MS system
